com.ambrosus

Class AmbrosusSDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ambrosus.AmbrosusSDK

  • public class AmbrosusSDK
extends java.lang.Object
    Core class from the Ambrosus SDK which enables interactions with the Ambrosus REST API. The REST API expects and sends JSON objects. For convenience, the SDK uses Google's gson library to automatically deserialize HTTP responses sent by the REST API.

    To leverage gson serialization/deserialization features, user-defined classes can be registered by calling registerEventDataType(String, Class, Object) )}. Doing so will allow the gson library to deserialize event data objects into plain Java objects. If you do not provide an adapter, event data extracted from the HTTP response will be stored as a JsonObject. See github.com/google/gson for additional information on how to define custom adapters for HTTP responses.

    Request calls made from the SDK are non-blocking; they execute concurrently and you should therefore put code handling the results inside a callback. The SDK uses the retrofit library to format and send the requests to the REST API. See for square.github.io/retrofit/ additional information.

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the web service for sending and receiving HTTP messages. The custom type adapter must be set before calling this function.

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String getAddress()
        Returns:
        The hexadecimal string address derived from the private key, prefixed by 0x

      • registerEventDataType

        public void registerEventDataType(java.lang.String typename,
                                  java.lang.Class<? extends EventData> typeClass)
        Registers an event data type to be used by the Json serializer/deserializer. Whenever an event data object is encoutered with the corresponding type name, the deserializer will try to use the provided class to store the JSON properties.
        Parameters:
        typename - The Ambrosus type name of the event data object. For example, ambrosus.asset.info is a valid event data type name.
        typeClass - The class to be used to host the JSON properties extracted from the object.

      • registerEventDataType

        public void registerEventDataType(java.lang.String typename,
                                  java.lang.Class<? extends EventData> typeClass,
                                  java.lang.Object adapter)
        Registers an event data type to be used by the Json serializer/deserializer. Whenever an event data object is encoutered with the corresponding type name, the deserializer will try to use the provided class to store the JSON properties. When the JSON object is complex or when the result of automatic deserialization/serialization is unsatisfactory, use this method to provide a type adapter which can translate back and forth between plain Java and JSON representations.
        Parameters:
        typename - The Ambrosus type name of the event data object. For example, ambrosus.asset.info is a valid event data type name.
        typeClass - The class to be used to host the JSON properties extracted from the object.

      • getAsset

        public void getAsset(java.lang.String assetId,
                     com.ambrosus.utils.Consumer<ResponseWrapper<Asset>> assetConsumer,
                     com.ambrosus.utils.BiConsumer<retrofit2.Call<Asset>,java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Requests from the API the asset whose ID matches the one given in parameter.
        Parameters:
        assetId - The identifier of the asset to retrieve
        assetConsumer - A consumer able to handle the asset if the request is successful or null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call

        public void getAssetWithEvents(java.lang.String assetId,
                               com.ambrosus.utils.Consumer<Asset> successConsumer,
                               com.ambrosus.utils.BiConsumer<retrofit2.Call<?>,java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Requests from the API the asset whose ID matches the one given in parameter. Additionally retrieve all event associated to this asset before delivering the asset to the consumer callback.

      • createAsset

        public void createAsset(Asset.Builder assetBuilder,
                        com.ambrosus.utils.Consumer<ResponseWrapper<Asset>> assetConsumer,
                        com.ambrosus.utils.BiConsumer<retrofit2.Call<Asset>,java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Requests the Ambrosus API to create an empty asset.
        Parameters:
        assetBuilder - An asset builder. The SDK will complete the builder if needed with the creator's address, the timestamp and the sequence number.
        assetConsumer - A consumer able to handle the newly created asset or null if an error occurred during the operation
        errorConsumer - A consumer able to handle two arguments, the first one being the retrofit call made by the SDK to the API and the second the throwable that was raised during the execution of this call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call

      • getEvents

        public void getEvents(java.lang.String assetId,
                      com.ambrosus.utils.Consumer<ResponseWrapper<EventQueryResponse>> ambQueryResultConsumer,

        Requests the Ambrosus API to retrieve all the events associated to an asset.
        Parameters:
        assetId - The identifier of the asset from which to retrieve the events
        ambQueryResultConsumer - A consumer able to handle the retrieved events if the request is successful or null otherwise
        errorConsumer - A consumer able to handle two arguments, the first one being the retrofit call made by the SDK to the API and the second the throwable that was raised during the execution of this call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call

      • createEvent

        public void createEvent(Event.Builder eventBuilder,
                        com.ambrosus.utils.Consumer<ResponseWrapper<Event>> eventConsumer,
                        com.ambrosus.utils.BiConsumer<retrofit2.Call<Event>,java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Requests the Ambrosus API to store a new event
        Parameters:
        eventBuilder - An event builder with the asset ID already set. The SDK will complete id needed the creator's address, the timestamp and the access level (defaults to 0).
        eventConsumer - A consumer able to handle the newly created event
        errorConsumer - A consumer able to handle two arguments, the first one being the retrofit call made by the SDK to the API and the second the throwable that was raised during the execution of this call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the asset ID was not set in the builder

      • findAssets

        public void findAssets(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params,
                       com.ambrosus.utils.Consumer<ResponseWrapper<AssetQueryResponse>> assetQueryConsumer,
                       com.ambrosus.utils.BiConsumer<retrofit2.Call<AssetQueryResponse>,java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Queries the API for assets
        Parameters:
        params - A query parameters map. Accepted parameters are: - perPage: number of assets to return per page - page: page number - createdBy: address of the account that created the targeted events - fromTimestamp: earliest timestamp for the asset - toTimestamp: latest timestamp for the asset - identifier: This syntax allows to query for assets that have an associated event containing data type ambrosus.event.identifier (see Events Data field section) with same identifier of same type. It is possible to find identifiers matching a pattern with help of the pattern decorator. You can use like this: identifier[vin]=pattern(3FRNF65N*). It supports 2 kinds of special characters: * matches any string, including the null string. ? matches any single character Note that patterns cannot have a special character as the first symbol for performance reasons. It is not possible to escape special characters.

        Example: identifier[{identifierType}]={identifierValue}

        assetQueryConsumer - A consumer callback for assets
        errorConsumer - A consumer able to handle two arguments, the first one being the retrofit call made by the SDK to the API and the second the throwable that was raised during the execution of this call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call

      • findEvents

        public void findEvents(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params,
                       com.ambrosus.utils.Consumer<ResponseWrapper<EventQueryResponse>> eventQueryConsumer,
                       com.ambrosus.utils.BiConsumer<retrofit2.Call<EventQueryResponse>,java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Queries the API for events
        Parameters:
        params - A query parameters map. Accepted parameters are: - assetId: ID of the asset the events are targeting - fromTimestamp: earlisest timestamp for the events - toTimestamp: latest timestamp for the events - perPage: number of events to return per page - page: page number - createdBy: address of the account that created the targeted events - data: This syntax allows to query for events by any fields in data array. QueryResponse for nested fields is possible, e.g. data[acceleration.x]=10. By default the type of the value is string. To provide a number, use data[acceleration.x]=number (10). To provide geo coordinates use data[geoJson]=geo(longitude, latitude, radius). It is possible to match data values by the pattern using the pattern decorator like so data[type]=pattern(ambrosus.event.*). It support 2 kinds of special characters: * matches any string, including the null string. ? matches any single character Note that patterns cannot have a special character as the first symbol for performance reasons. It is not possible to escape special characters.

        Example: data[type]=ambrosus.event.custom

        eventQueryConsumer - A consumer callback for events
        errorConsumer - A consumer able to handle two arguments, the first one being the retrofit call made by the SDK to the API and the second the throwable that was raised during the execution of this call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call

      • findAccounts

        public void findAccounts(java.lang.String token,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params,
                         com.ambrosus.utils.Consumer<ResponseWrapper<AccountQueryResponse>> accountQueryConsumer,
                         com.ambrosus.utils.BiConsumer<retrofit2.Call<AccountQueryResponse>,java.lang.Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Queries the API for accounts.
        Parameters:
        token - An authorization token to be transmitted to the API
        params - A query parameters map. Accepted parameters are: - accessLevel: Minimum access level of accounts to look for - perPage: number of assets to return per page - page: page number
        accountQueryConsumer - A consumer callback for accounts
        errorConsumer - A consumer able to handle two arguments, the first one being the retrofit call made by the SDK to the API and the second the throwable that was raised during the execution of this call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call

      • verifyDatahash

        public boolean verifyDatahash(Event event)
        Recomputes the data hash and compare it against the one stored in the event idData property
        Parameters:
        event - The event for which to verify the data hash
        Returns:
        True if the hashes match, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call

      • verifySignature

        public boolean verifySignature(Event event)
        Recovers the public address from the stored signature and compares it against the event's createdBy property.
        Parameters:
        event - The event for which to verify the signature
        Returns:
        True if the signatures match, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call

      • verifySignature

        public boolean verifySignature(Asset asset)
        Recovers the public address from the stored signature and compares it against the asset's createdBy property.
        Parameters:
        asset - The asset for which to verify the signature
        Returns:
        True if the signatures match, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SDK was not initialized before this call
